subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つばき}}

Derived as the {{m|ja|連用形||tr=ren'yōkei|continuative or stem form}} of now-[[Appendix:Glossary#obsolete|obsolete]] verb {{m|ja|唾吐く||tr=tsubaku|to [[spit]], to [[expectorate]]}}, itself from {{m|ja|唾||tr=tsu|[[saliva]]}} + {{m|ja|吐く||tr=haku|to [[expel]] from the [[mouth]]: to [[spit]], to [[vomit]], to [[exhale]]}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つば}}

Appears to be a shortening of ''tsubaki'' above.  Alternatively, may be a fusion of ''tsu'' below with particle {{m|ja|は||tr=wa|pos=originally ''pa'' in Old Japanese, combining in some cases as ''ba''}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つ}}

Appears to be the oldest form.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Possibly [[onomatopoeia]].
